duck: writing workshop, a gathering of writers for critique and inspiration

Workshop - Beginning with the Industrial Revolution era, a workshop may be a room or building which provides both the area and tools that may be required for the manufacture or repair of manufactured goods.
academic workshop, a smaller version of an academic conference
workshop definition: a small establishment where manufacturing or handicrafts are carried on.
photography workshop, in which a master photographer may lead photographers into the field to help them make images
Workshop of the Telescopes (2-disc set), greatest hits album by Blue Oyster Cult.
Sheltered workshop - The term sheltered workshop refers to an organisation or environment that employs people with disabilities separately from others.
Workshop (series), a web series focusing on struggling actor's lives in Hollywood.
Workshop production, a type of theatre performance.
Workshop Jazz Records, Motown's jazz subsidiary, active from 1962 to 1964;

wiki.text:
Beginning with the Industrial Revolution era, a 'workshop' may be a room or
building which provides both the area and tools (or machinery) that may be
required for the manufacture or repair of manufactured goods. Workshops were the
only places of production until the advent of industrialisation and the
development of larger factories.
wiki.title: workshop
